issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
When building an iOS app for device, then opening the generated Xcode project and trying to build, you get the following error:

{code}
TypeError: Cannot read property 'UIBackgroundModes' of undefined
    at iOSBuilder.processTiSymbols (/Users/chris/Library/Application Support/Titanium/mobilesdk/osx/3.2.0/iphone/cli/commands/_build.js:3035:34)
    at /Users/chris/Library/Application Support/Titanium/mobilesdk/osx/3.2.0/node_modules/node-appc/node_modules/async/lib/async.js:548:21
    at /Users/chris/Library/Application Support/Titanium/mobilesdk/osx/3.2.0/node_modules/node-appc/node_modules/async/lib/async.js:224:13
    at iterate (/Users/chris/Library/Application Support/Titanium/mobilesdk/osx/3.2.0/node_modules/node-appc/node_modules/async/lib/async.js:131:13)
    at /Users/chris/Library/Application Support/Titanium/mobilesdk/osx/3.2.0/node_modules/node-appc/node_modules/async/lib/async.js:142:25
    at /Users/chris/Library/Application Support/Titanium/mobilesdk/osx/3.2.0/node_modules/node-appc/node_modules/async/lib/async.js:226:17
    at /Users/chris/Library/Application Support/Titanium/mobilesdk/osx/3.2.0/node_modules/node-appc/node_modules/async/lib/async.js:553:34
    at /Users/chris/appc/titanium/lib/hook.js:214:18
    at /Users/chris/appc/titanium/node_modules/async/lib/async.js:229:13
    at async.eachSeries (/Users/chris/appc/titanium/node_modules/async/lib/async.js:127:20)
---------------------------------------------
    at iOSBuilder.<anonymous> (/Users/chris/Library/Application Support/Titanium/mobilesdk/osx/3.2.0/iphone/cli/commands/_build.js:2919:15)
    at async.whilst (/Users/chris/Library/Application Support/Titanium/mobilesdk/osx/3.2.0/node_modules/async/lib/async.js:616:13)
    at iOSBuilder.<anonymous> (/Users/chris/Library/Application Support/Titanium/mobilesdk/osx/3.2.0/iphone/cli/commands/_build.js:2898:13)
    at /Users/chris/appc/titanium/lib/hook.js:221:13
    at /Users/chris/appc/titanium/node_modules/async/lib/async.js:229:13
    at async.eachSeries (/Users/chris/appc/titanium/node_modules/async/lib/async.js:127:20)
    at _asyncMap (/Users/chris/appc/titanium/node_modules/async/lib/async.js:223:9)
    at Object.mapSeries (/Users/chris/appc/titanium/node_modules/async/lib/async.js:213:23)
{code}
fields.summary: CLI: Xcode builds fail when building for iOS device
fields.environment:
Xcode 5.0.2
Mac OS X 10.8.5 (Mountain Lion)
Titanium SDK 3.2.X

comments.body:
Titanium SDK master pull request: https://github.com/appcelerator/titanium_mobile/pull/5104
Titanium SDK 3.2.x pull request: https://github.com/appcelerator/titanium_mobile/pull/5105

To test:
1) create an ios project
2) do a device build
3) open the generated xcode project in xcode
4) run the app for device

Verified the issue with tested Environment:

Appcelerator Studio: 3.2.0.201312091648
SDK:3.2.0.v20131209192649
alloy: 1.3.0-cr
acs: 1.0.10
npm: 1.3.2
titanium: 3.2.0-cr
titanium-code-processor: 1.1.0-cr
Xcode:5.0.2
OS: Mac OSX 10.9
Device: iPad3(v7.0), iPhone5S(v7.0.2)

xcodeProject running fine on both simulators as well as devices from Xcode 5.0.2
